definition[0]: based on the belief of a government or organization that it should take action or spend money to influence the economy (=financial system)  or what happens in other countries
example[0]: The UN adopted a more interventionist approach in the region.
definition[1]: believing that a government should try to influence trade by spending government money
example[1]: interventionist policies in the car industry
example[2]: We favour an interventionist role for government in the economy.
